instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]Toshiba L850 PLR/CSF
threads.message:
Somebody replaced the screen with main battery. 
Without RTC battery, board power cycling each 1seg. CPU core present at 1V.
PCH or KBC suspect?

threads.title: [SOLVED]Toshiba L850 PLR/CSF
threads.message:
I replaced KBC. Now it power up and got video but only works without RTC battery. If I put rtc battery doesnot power.
I have another L850 and already tried another power button and cable and I checked 3V goes to 0 when power button is pressed.

Any idea why it doesnot power with power button?

threads.title: [SOLVED]Toshiba L850 PLR/CSF
threads.message: I assume you did not solder the KBC correctly.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Toshiba L850 PLR/CSF
threads.message:
it is PLF/CSF schematic but there is no schematic for this board.
I can shutdown this board from power button. I just cannot power the board.
I replaced KBC again and all the same.

Could be PCH problem?

threads.title: [SOLVED]Toshiba L850 PLR/CSF
threads.message: This is usually a lid sensor issue. No idea where and how that works on this thing.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Toshiba L850 PLR/CSF
threads.message:
You are the Master, yes. Pretty easy to find LID in this board. It connec to pin 75 and it was on 0.6V. I force it to 3.3V but all the same. Then I found out that KBC 775 I put is version P and original one is version L. Then I replaced KBC again and now it works and I have 3.3V in pin 75 - LID
I also compared all 128 pins between both KBC and there were 7 different. Now it works. Thanks Duke
